Description.Regular:
<Target.Name>: If the gods don't exist, then how come there are all these votive images of people who have survived sea storms by praying to the gods?

<Creator.Name>: Well, where are all the images of those who suffered shipwreck and died?
Description.Success: <Creator.Name>'s argument, reminiscent of the Greek philosopher Diagoras of Melos, undermined <Target.Name>'s beliefs.

Description.Failure: $TopContributor was instrumental in maintaining the status quo.

Effects.Description: Force target to skip a training session

Description.Regular: <Creator.Name> is going to the [i]popina[/i] to have a couple of drinks and some fun. All a Roman needs is a strong wine, a shady friend and a loaded die.
Description.Success: <Creator.Name>'s night at the [i]popina[/i] was a success!
Description.Failure: It turns out that the [i]popina[/i] isn't the place for <Creator.Name> afterall.

Requirements.Description: Not too drunk to leave home

Description.Failure: You made a bad financial decision.

Description.Regular:
Birds fly upon the sky of the Forum. Atop the steps of a temple, a dark-hooded priest looks up, watching. His eyes read the words of Jupiter in the flight of the birds, his ears listen to the voice of Venus in their singing.

[i]What are the gods saying?[/i]
Description.Success:
The birds flutter away into the sky. The augur turns to the crowd, a smile on his face. He thrusts his open palms up and announces: "The gods smiles upon us all!"

The crowd erupts into cheers. At least for today, all is well in the eyes of Jupiter.
Description.Failure: The augur goes back into the temple. Were the omens favorable? <Creator.Name> was distracted by something (or someone) and didn't catch it. Perhaps this is a personal omen?
